text: Troilo Agnesi was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Guardialfiera (1498–?), (in Latin) Bishop of Lavello (1487–1498), (in Latin) Bishop of Telese o Cerreto Sannita (1483–1487), (in Latin) and Bishop of Penne e Atri (1482–1483). (in Latin) ==Biography== On 30 October 1482, Troilo Agnesi was appointed during the papacy of Pope Sixtus IV as Bishop of Penne e Atri. On 17 December 1483, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Sixtus IV as Bishop of Telese o Cerreto Sannita. On 12 February 1487, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Innocent VIII as Bishop of Lavello. On 4 July 1498, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Alexander VI as Bishop of Guardialfiera. It is uncertain how long he served as Bishop of Guardialfiera; the next bishop of record is Marco Antonio Vascheri who was appointed in 1510. ==See also== *Catholic Church in Italy == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (Chronology of Bishops) * (Chronology of Bishops) * (Chronology of Bishops) * (Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:15th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Sixtus IV Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Innocent VIII Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Alexander VI
title: Troilo Agnesi
